SEARCH
Package controller

Class AuthenticationController

java.lang.Object
controller.AuthenticationController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/auth") @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:5173") public class AuthenticationController extends Object
REST controller for authentication operations. Handles user login, logout, password management, and authentication status checking.

This controller provides the following endpoints:

  • POST /api/auth/login - User login with credentials
  • POST /api/auth/logout - User logout and session termination
  • POST /api/auth/change-password - Change user password
  • GET /api/auth/status - Check if user is authenticated
Since:
2025-10-07
Version:
2.0
Author:
SC2002 SCED Group-6

  • Method Details

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<LoginResponse>> login(@RequestBody LoginRequest request)
      Authenticates a user with their credentials.

      Endpoint: POST /api/auth/login

      Request Body:

      
 {
   "userId": "U2310001A",
   "password": "password"
 }

      Success Response (200 OK):

      
 {
   "success": true,
   "data": {
     "userId": "U2310001A",
     "name": "Tan Wei Ling",
     "role": "STUDENT",
     "email": "tan001@e.ntu.edu.sg",
     "token": "auth-token-uuid"
   },
   "message": "Login successful",
   "timestamp": "2025-01-15T14:30:00"
 }
      Parameters:
      request - Login request containing userId and password
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with login response containing user data and auth token
      Throws:
      UnauthorizedException - if credentials are invalid
      ResourceNotFoundException - if user not found
      InvalidInputException - if input validation fails

    • logout

      @PostMapping("/logout") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<Void>> logout(@RequestParam String userId)
      Logs out the current user and terminates their session.

      Endpoint: POST /api/auth/logout

      Query Parameters:

      • userId - The user ID to logout

      Success Response (200 OK):

      
 {
   "success": true,
   "data": null,
   "message": "Logout successful",
   "timestamp": "2025-01-15T14:35:00"
 }
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to logout
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with success message

    • changePassword

      @PostMapping("/change-password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<Void>> changePassword(@RequestParam String userId, @RequestBody ChangePasswordRequest request)
      Changes a user's password.

      Endpoint: POST /api/auth/change-password

      Query Parameters:

      • userId - The user ID whose password to change

      Request Body:

      
 {
   "oldPassword": "currentPassword",
   "newPassword": "newPassword123"
 }

      Success Response (200 OK):

      
 {
   "success": true,
   "data": null,
   "message": "Password changed successfully",
   "timestamp": "2025-01-15T14:40:00"
 }
      Parameters:
      userId - The user ID whose password to change
      request - Change password request containing old and new passwords
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with success message
      Throws:
      UnauthorizedException - if old password is incorrect
      InvalidInputException - if new password is invalid
      ResourceNotFoundException - if user not found

    • checkAuthStatus

      @GetMapping("/status") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<Boolean>> checkAuthStatus(@RequestParam String userId)
      Checks if a user is currently authenticated.

      Endpoint: GET /api/auth/status

      Query Parameters:

      • userId - The user ID to check

      Success Response (200 OK):

      
 {
   "success": true,
   "data": true,
   "message": "User is authenticated",
   "timestamp": "2025-01-15T14:45:00"
 }
      Parameters:
      userId - The user ID to check
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with authentication status

    • registerRepresentative

      @PostMapping("/register-representative") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<Void>> registerRepresentative(@RequestBody RegisterRepresentativeRequest request)
      Registers a new company representative (pending approval).

      Endpoint: POST /api/auth/register-representative

      Request Body:

      
 {
   "representativeId": "charlielim@gmail.com",
   "name": "Charlie Lim",
   "email": "charlielim@gmail.com",
   "password": "password",
   "companyName": "Microsoft",
   "industry": "Technology",
   "position": "Sales Executive"
 }

      Success Response (200 OK):

      
 {
   "success": true,
   "data": null,
   "message": "Registration submitted successfully. Please wait for staff approval.",
   "timestamp": "2025-01-15T15:00:00"
 }
      Parameters:
      request - Registration request containing representative details
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with success message
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - if input validation fails
      BusinessRuleException - if representative already exists
